author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Zimbabwe's fief, Mnangagwa ascends,  
By Odin's might, a second term attends.  
Yet clouded is his claim of victory fair,  
In whispers, fraud and suppression fill the air.  

In lands where Dragon's wisdom reigns supreme,  
Complexities of faith twist economic dream.  
For new dawn's light is masked by past's decree,  
Just as the tide cannot escape the sea.  

In East, where Rising Sun casts golden glow,   
Stock-device gears in companies do show.  
They heed the call for worth and honor high,  
Like storm-tossed ships chasing a clear sky.

feedItems.title: Zimbabwe's Incumbent President Declared Winner of Election
feedItems.description: Emmerson Mnangagwa secured a second term as president after winning 53% of the vote in a poll marred by repression and allegations of fraud.

feedItems.title: Communist Party Priorities Complicate Plans to Revive China's Economy
feedItems.description: Ideology is driving Beijing’s economic policy to a degree not seen since the opening to the West nearly half a century ago.

feedItems.title: Japanese Companies Are Making Big Promises to Boost Their Stock Prices
feedItems.description: The Tokyo Stock Exchange has pushed them to pay closer attention to market valuation and shareholder return.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon yonder Wall Street, in the waning light,
Long-term rates surge, a foreboding sight.
Markets tremble, stocks face the blow,
A storm doth gather, futures bow low.

Upon the realm of wealth, a tale unfurls,
In the priciest corner of America's pearls.
A rich tapestry of fortunes unseen,
Harboured within a zip code serene. 

In each epoch of life, wisdom's decree,
An age  when financial craft is free.
Research hath claimed this truth unfurled,
In certain years, our best decisions unfurled.

feedItems.title: Rising Long-Term Rates Loom Over Wall Street
feedItems.description: Futures markets show a growing expectation that interest rates could stay higher for longer, exerting pressure on stocks.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Inside the most expensive zip code in America

feedItems.title: The Exact Age When You Make Your Best Financial Decisions
feedItems.description: Research has pinpointed the prime years for making smart financial decisions.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
From gambler's folly sprouted, a scandal most foul,
A bet made in jest, hath led to a howl,
Such treach'dous sport, by mischief and guile,
Yet God sees it all, each secret defile.

'Bout Barker, we sing, host of great might,
Whose 'Price is Right' ushered day into night.
In Heaven's great market, God asks him ‘come down’,
His wares be his virtues, his halo his crown.

A contest of fortune, stocks high and low,
Who knows which way the wild winds will blow?
The monks favor ale stocks, the friars love grain,
Yet, in God's own market, 'tis virtue comes rain.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The bet that launched a college sports scandal

feedItems.title: Bob Barker, Longtime 'Price Is Right' Host, Dies at 99
feedItems.description: He welcomed contestants to “come on down” for more than 30 years as American consumer culture evolved.

feedItems.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
feedItems.description: Read about our columnists’ most- and least-favorite stocks as they make their choices.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of Aniston whose fame adorneth our visage veil,
Her habit, 'pon breaking, enshrined in tell-tale,
Cancel culture's knave, 'tis the pest she doth rail,
In her interview of yore, revealed without fail. 

In Moscow’s cold grasp, lies one Gershkovich bound,
His quill stilled by shackles, no freedom is found,
Lawyers plead for release, appeal echoes with sound,
Till late-November's grasp, his fate thusly crowned. 

Then Barker, jest's monarch, with contest so bright,
Price's truth for three decades, in his regalia's light.
Unrehearsed,-spontaneous joy, day or nighttime’s sight,
Verses honour his standing, under TV's starlight.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The Jennifer Aniston interview: One habit she wishes she could break, and how she is over cancel culture

feedItems.title: Lawyers for Evan Gershkovich Appeal Extension of Pretrial Detention
feedItems.description: Lawyers for jailed Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich have appealed a Moscow court’s decision to extend his pretrial detention until Nov. 30.

feedItems.title: TV Game-Show Host Bob Barker Was Popular for Decades
feedItems.description: He appeared as host of “The Price Is Right” for 30-plus years, describing his job as creating “spontaneous entertainment with unrehearsed contestants.”
